data: {"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3148293,"name":"Henry Mahnke","username":"Henry_Mahnke","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/henry_mahnke/{size}/184033_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-18T23:53:32.252Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eHello!\u003cbr\u003e\nWe are wondering if on our shoulder it would be better to set the ticks of our falcon with our pigeon(that we use for the angle on the output shaft) and run motion magic on all of the falcons, or if we should use follower. We have previously tried to use the .follow method in the constructor of the class, but that didn’t move any of the other motors when we commanded the 1 using percent output. When we use controlmode.follow, it seems to work, but I’m wondering the implications of that when using motion magic, will there be a delay on those motors of 20ms? Will they be running pseudo motion magic and interpolating between the setpoints, what is it doing in the backend?
